channel.title: Photography on Well lets take a look at it, Mr Gumby!
channel.description: Recent content in Photography on Well lets take a look at it, Mr Gumby!

item.title: Joe's Birthday Foraging Frenzy
item.description: For my 30th birthday my friends bought me a day out with the foraging fanatic Fergus Drennan and what a day it was! It ran from 08:30 until 22:00 and was rammed full of quirky tastings, information overloads, and fruitful foraging. The Park The Park -- After meeting at the train station we all piled into three cars and headed down to the park. Fergus sat us down in a circle beside a pond full of mace reed and started removing numerous berries on their branches from his backpack.

item.title: Zurich
item.description: function writeImage ( path ) { var text = " " document.write(text) } Oskar’s final interview! Did he get it? at the point of writing this, we still don’t know! What we did know is that Oskar had decided he was taking Jamie and I to Zurich. I’m still not sure how it all came about but three boys in a hole went on tour! We arrived in Zurich (Joe and Jamie) and found Oskar after some major confusion over how big Zurich train station was.

item.title: Avoriaz
item.description: function writeImage ( path ) { var text = " " document.write(text) } June 2020. We all went on a little summer trip to Avoriaz. Or somewhere close? Heres a picture of the ‘Super best friends’ as Branko would say and obviously theres always one person to have their eyes closed and in this instance, it was Jamie. Maybe oskar too with his blind man glasses on. writeImage("/photography/images/Avoriaz/DSC_1025.jpg"); Very close to the cabin was a lovely little lake with a bbq area.

item.title: Morocco - The Atlas Mountains
item.description: In August 2018 my friends and I visited the Atlas mountains of Morocco and walked up Mount Toubkal. Despite my camera having a horrendous light leak I managed to get a few photos of that walk. We had envisioned a hike though the Atlas mountains off the typical tourist route, following the Berber trails. It became apparent after the first day of ascent that we weren’t equipped for this route. I remember feeling the exposure of the desert mountains, not being able to hide from the sun and slipping down constantly.

item.title: Lancaster
item.description: This photo was taken on a walk around Bowland forest whilst I was studying at the University of Lancaster. It must be dated around 2016 and was shot on a Rolleiflex camera with Rollei IR400 Film. Ribblehead viaduct! This was taken on a separate trip. My friend Cristina convinced me and my friend Zane that this was infact the viaduct from Harry Potter that the Hogwarts Express crossed! It is not.
